Q: How to place the mounting pole for your hose reel?
O: (A) Mark the center of the top swivel bushing mount. Place the bushing centerline over this mark and mark the center of the two holes that will need to be drilled for the lag bolts. Drill the holes for the lag bolts and mount the top bushing by screwing in the two lag bolts. Align the top bushing over the two holes you drilled into the concrete and mount the top bushing by screwing in the two masonry bolts into the concrete. (B) Mark the center of the top swivel bushing mount. Place the bushing centerline over this mark and mark the center of the two holes that will need to be drilled for the lag bolts. Drill the holes for the lag bolts and mount the top bushing by screwing in the two lag bolts. Align the bottom bushing over the two holes you drilled into the concrete and mount the bottom bushing by screwing in the two masonry bolts into the concrete.

Question: How do I turn on a desktop computer?
Choices: (A) You need to insert a screwdriver in an electrical socket while your second hands touches two metal pins on the motherboard. (B) Using a metal screwdriver, you need to connect two metal pins on the motherboard (power and ground).

To turn on a desktop computer, you simply need to press the power button on the computer case. This button is usually located on the front or top of the case and is labeled with a power symbol. Pressing this button sends a signal to the power supply unit (PSU) to start supplying power to the motherboard, which then boots up the computer. It is important to note that you should never attempt to turn on a computer by inserting a screwdriver into an electrical socket or connecting two metal pins on the motherboard with a screwdriver, as this can cause serious damage to the computer and pose a risk of electric shock.

Turning on a desktop computer does not involve inserting a screwdriver into an electrical socket. Instead, it typically involves pressing the power button on the computer or connecting two metal pins on the motherboard (power and ground) using a metal screwdriver

Connecting two metal pins on the motherboard using a metal screwdriver is not a safe or recommended method for turning on a desktop computer. It can cause serious damage to the computer and pose a risk of electric shock. The correct and safe method is to simply press the power button on the computer case.
